Nat!'s Dis-Dis-Dis-kritik

The reviews have been lovingly enhanced with a few small scanned CD-sleeves. If you like the reviews you might want to check here every two weeks or so, since I do them only when I am bored (or avoiding work). There is no real selection criteria, as to which bands are reviewed. If I like the cover and want to scan it, it's got a good chance of getting a review. If I am totally disappointed maybe, if I am really enthusiastic about it probably. If its a bit obscure thats all the better...

Unless (all ?) other reviews I am aware of, these review pages are updated if the need arises.

Hypes & Dissings

  • Joe Stump Night of the Living Shred
  • Annihilator Refresh the Daemon
  • Various Artists Rave Base #5
  • Moby First album w/o a name
  • Moby Everything is wrong REMIX
  • Atari Teenage Riot 1995
  • Moonspell Irreligious
  • Diabolical Masquerade Ravendusk in my heart
  • Dimmu Borgir Enthrone Darkness Triumphant

Quickies

There is a little rating scheme now in effect, that merely says the following:
  • ***** this one is a must have at any price
  • **** this is a good buy at regular price
  • *** this is a good record to buy if you have excess money
  • ** buy this when you see it in a bargain bin
  • * don't buy it
    •  

    Fatal Opera  
    **

    		  

    Think about Mutation 
    **

    		  

    apollo four forty 
    *****

    		  

    daft punk 
    **
    Good record, but no progress compared to the debut, rather get that instead. This is progressive metal with a singer not lacking in testosterones (like all the others) Few good songs, but no longevity. Also a bit disappointing. 
    I think you can make a bit more out of metal meeting techno. But the lists of bands who tried and failed is endless.    		 Much quieter, than I expected from the two hits "Krupa" and "Ain't talking..". The rest is also excellent. One of the top albums in 1997. It's french, it sounds funny, there aren't any good songs on it. It's french! Total media hype. Ok but it does sound funny, which is a good thing...
     

    Samael 
    ***

    		  

    Emperor 
    ***

    		  

    Prodigy 
    ****

    		  

    Hardcore Champions 
    *
    Another black metal band swimming in more commerical waters. Dark, depressing, good. Avantgarde black metal. Very avantgarde! Voivod and Megadeth meet beelzebub in an opera house. This ain't easy listening. As good as expected by the singles, though I like the Jilted Generation better. Kings of trash techno! But who let Keith on the mic ? A 3-CD Compilation! The best track - no doubt - is "Stricher" by Nordcore. Gabber just doesn't do it in your living room.
     

    Tiamat 
    *

    		  

    Chemical Brothers 
    ****

    		  

    Atari Teenage Riot 
    *

    		  

    Waltari 
    ***
    Ambient background kinda music, very nicely psychedelic, very slightly boring. Dinner music. Not a must buy by a large margin. Right on the level of the previous record, although nothing matches "Leave Home". Very close behind the Prodigy. What a disappointment, less energy, less ideas than on the predecessor. They sacrificed the riffs for more noise, not a good idea to my ears. My favorite band on a steady decline since Torcha. This record is overproduced and lacks Sami. I also hate the classical stuff. Three great tracks on it though.
    Back to the Moo-sick
